nodes.body: As in Literary Tibetan, there are several registers of politeness in Spoken Tibetan. The basic difference is between a form of polite speech (ཞེ་ས་) and ordinary speech (སྐད་དཀྱུས་མ་). In polite speech, honorific expressions are used for the 2nd and 3rd persons, while humilific expressions are used for the 1st person. ཞེ་ས་ is expressed mainly through personal pronouns, nouns, verbs and their auxiliaries.
nodes.title: Levels of Language (Registers)
